title: Robben Island: Prison to Heritage Site
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Robben Island: Prison to Heritage Site.

hook.text: Nelson Mandela spent 18 of his 27 prison years in a tiny cell on Robben Island, off Cape Town.

buildup.text: The island had been a prison, a hospital, and a military base across four centuries of colonial rule.

discovery.text: Mandela and other prisoners secretly educated each other, turning the jail into an informal university.

twist.text: After apartheid ended, the government turned the prison into a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

climax.text: Former prisoners now guide tourists through the same cells where they once suffered.

punchline.text: A prison became a monument to freedom.

quiz.question: How long did Nelson Mandela spend imprisoned on Robben Island?
